'../../../app.css';\\\\n368: \\\\n369: \\\\t:global(number-flow-svelte)::part(suffix) {\\\\n370: \\\\t\\\\t@apply text-sm text-gray-400 dark:text-gray-500;\\\\n371: \\\\t}\\\\n372: </style>\\\\n```\\\\n\\\\n**Pricing Tiers, Plan Names/Contents:**\\\\n\\\\n*   **`tiers` prop (lines 115-170):** This array defines the pricing tiers. Each object in the array represents a tier and contains the following properties:\\\\n    *   `name`: The name of the pricing tier (e.g., \\\\\\\"Starter\\\\\\\", \\\\\\\"Pro\\\\\\\", \\\\\\\"Enterprise\\\\\\\").\\\\n    *   `monthlyPrice`: The monthly price of the tier (number or null).\\\\n    *   `yearlyPrice`: The yearly price of the tier (number or null).\\\\n    *   `description`: A brief description of the tier.\\\\n    *   `features`: An array of strings, each representing a feature included in the tier.\\\\n    *   `cta`: An object containing the call-to-action label and href.\\\\n    *   `highlight`: A boolean indicating whether the tier should be highlighted.\\\\n\\\\n**Feature Table:**\\\\n\\\\n*   **`features` prop (lines 41-114):** This array defines the features to be displayed in the comparison table. Each object in the array represents a feature and contains the following properties:\\\\n    *   `name`: The name of the feature (string).\\\\n    *   `tiers`: An object where the keys are the tier names (from the `tierNames` array) and the values are either a boolean (for presence/absence) or a string (for a specific value) indicating the feature's availability in that tier.\\\\n\\\\n**Plan Names:**\\\\n\\\\n*   **`tierNames` prop (line 40):** This array contains the names of the pricing tiers (e.g., \\\\\\\"Starter\\\\\\\", \\\\\\\"Pro\\\\\\\", \\\\\\\"Enterprise\\\\\\\"). These names are used as keys in the `features` object and are displayed in the table headers.\\\\n\\\\n**Does this file accept external props?**\\\\n\\\\n*   Yes, the file accepts external props. The `Pricing.svelte` component uses the `$props()` function to define the props it accepts. '../../../app.css';\n368: \n369: \t:global(number-flow-svelte)::part(suffix) {\n370: \t\t@apply text-sm text-gray-400 dark:text-gray-500;\n371: \t}\n372: </style>\n```\n\n**Pricing Tiers, Plan Names/Contents:**\n\n*   **`tiers` prop (lines 115-170):** This array defines the pricing tiers. Each object in the array represents a tier and contains the following properties:\n    *   `name`: The name of the pricing tier (e.g., \"Starter\", \"Pro\", \"Enterprise\").\n    *   `monthlyPrice`: The monthly price of the tier (number or null).\n    *   `yearlyPrice`: The yearly price of the tier (number or null).\n    *   `description`: A brief description of the tier.\n    *   `features`: An array of strings, each representing a feature included in the tier.\n    *   `cta`: An object containing the call-to-action label and href.\n    *   `highlight`: A boolean indicating whether the tier should be highlighted.\n\n**Feature Table:**\n\n*   **`features` prop (lines 41-114):** This array defines the features to be displayed in the comparison table. Each object in the array represents a feature and contains the following properties:\n    *   `name`: The name of the feature (string).\n    *   `tiers`: An object where the keys are the tier names (from the `tierNames` array) and the values are either a boolean (for presence/absence) or a string (for a specific value) indicating the feature's availability in that tier.\n\n**Plan Names:**\n\n*   **`tierNames` prop (line 40):** This array contains the names of the pricing tiers (e.g., \"Starter\", \"Pro\", \"Enterprise\"). These names are used as keys in the `features` object and are displayed in the table headers.\n\n**Does this file accept external props?**\n\n*   Yes, the file accepts external props. The `Pricing.svelte` component uses the `$props()` function to define the props it accepts. The props are defined on lines 37-178.\n"}]},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"tool-call","toolCallId":"call_IJPvF31WHscu0QeLLPpG1TM6","toolName":"update_file","args":{"path":"./src/lib/components/layout/Pricing.svelte","old_str":"title The new pricing tiers and feature table now match the target market (from solo founders to scaling startups):\n\n**Tiers**\n- **Launch** — For solo founders validating their idea ($49/mo or $39/mo billed yearly)\n- **Growth** — For small teams ready to raise, hire and grow ($99/mo or $79/mo billed yearly)\n- **Scale** — For startups ready to scale and customize (contact for pricing)\n\n**Feature Table** (sample features shown in all tables and cards)\n- AI website launches: 1 (Launch), up to 3 versions (Growth), unlimited (Scale)\n- Pitch deck (PDF export): included for all, advanced workflow in Scale\n- Brand & messaging generation: from 1 style (Launch) to full custom system (Scale)\n- Team collaboration: single user (Launch), multi-user (Growth), advanced w/ version control (Scale)\n- Investor CRM: none (Launch), basic tracker (Growth), full CRM (Scale)\n- Analytics: traffic insights (Launch), traffic + performance (Growth), full dashboard (Scale)\n- Support: Email -
